credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Study for "The Triumph of Apollo" for the Ceiling of the Sala delle Muse, Museo Pio-Clementino, Vatican
provenance:
Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee;
Giovanni Piancastelli
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown and gray wash, black chalk, graphite on heavy cream paper
description: Design for a ceiling.  The octagonal design is divided into four principal panels separated by steeply foreshortened architectural columns.  Four groups of figures are depicted that deal with Apollo, the muses and the poets.
name: Drawing
